English.Text: The doctor agrees to be an accomplice, and his complicity proves vital. Dispensing with his moral objections, your medic produces a poison that causes rapid respiratory failure. A man known to be loyal to the captain secretly administers it, and within a few days the chief firebrand of the mutineers is dead. "Cancer of the lung," says the doctor, "most probably caused by stress." No-one suspects a thing, but the officers must keep a terrible secret.
